intro: Prionosciadium moschatum, commonly known as the mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a mild, pleasant scent, which contributes to its common name. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its subtle fragrance.
